name: LFO
description: This algorithm offers a number of flexible low frequency oscillators. The global ‘Quality’ parameter provides two options: ‘Stepped’ quality is extremely low CPU usage and suitable for automating parameters of other algorithms via mapping, while ‘Linear’ quality should be selected if you intend to use the LFOs to output CVs to other modules. The LFOs can run freely or be synced to external clocks or MIDI clock. When using multiple LFO channels (1-4), channels 2-4 can be phase-locked to channel 1, allowing for configurations like quadrature LFOs. Phase-locking is controlled by the ‘Phase’ parameter of channels 2-4, which sets their relationship in degrees relative to LFO 1; note that ‘Speed’ and ‘Multiplier’ parameters are ignored when phase-locked.
use_cases: Automating parameters of other algorithms via mapping (using 'Stepped' quality)
Generating CV outputs for external modules ('Linear' quality)
Creating complex modulation patterns with phase-locked LFOs
Syncing to MIDI clock or transport for tempo-based modulation
Resetting LFO phases using external triggers
gui_description: The display shows the shape of the current channel’s output waveform. If the ‘Globals’ page is active, it displays the waveforms of all channels simultaneously.

specifications.name: Quality modes
specifications.description: 'Stepped' mode offers extremely low CPU usage, while 'Linear' mode provides higher-quality CV output.

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: The bus used for external clock synchronization, if selected in the 'Sync' parameter.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: The bus used to reset LFO phase when triggered (applies depending on sync mode or standalone trigger).

output_ports.name: LFO output
output_ports.description: Outputs CV signals from the selected channel(s) to other modules. Each channel can be routed to a specific bus.
